ygData.subject: RE: Selos and trains underground
ygData.msgSnippet: Well I must admit that my speed did indeed cause what several people told me was the biggest train in Cazic-Thule that I ve ever seen .  A few levels back
ygData.messageBody:
Well I must admit that my speed did indeed cause what several people told me
was 'the biggest train in Cazic-Thule that I've ever seen'. A few levels
back before I knew Cazic-Thule better than the route from bedroom to
bathroom in my house, I was at the back of the Archon temple with a group.
We got overrun by lizards and were in the process of getting wiped out. I
equipped my drum and hit Selo's and took off when "zone" was called. I sped
around the temple once, picking up lizards the whole way. I came a full 360
around the base of the building to try and pick up any still-breathing party
members with my song. There were none, so I proceeded to speed another 180
degrees around the building to the exit into the maze. By now I'm trailing
maybe 15-20 lizards behind me. Then I hit the maze. The maze is just that,
and I got lost. While frantically searching for the way out, I'm getting
hit by lizards that I blaze past and picking them up in turn. Well by the
time I finally managed to stagger into the courtyard croak I've got an
untold number of lizards on my ass. I was only informed of my apparent
informal record-setting status during my corpse retrieval, often with
language that would make a Army Sergeant blush.

This is one of those events that taught me that sometimes it *is* just best
to die.

Crier Sharpsong - 35th song bard of Fennin Ro

> PS Yes Unrest is famous for trains. None of the ones I have seen were

> greater incompetence, and large agro radius that causes horrible trains in

> are. The worst trains of all occur in Guk where it is underground. Being

> > had zero chance of escape and the caster's had zero chance of
> death. And
> > they said Selo's was unbalancing in allowing train avoidance indoors?
> Yeah,
> > right.
>
> Not quite. They are not concerned about you avoiding a train. They don't
> want you pulling huge trains to zone.
>
> > How fast travel can be unbalancing but instantaneous travelling is
> > not I fail to see.
>
> Instantaneous travel doesn't cause the train to keep running to
> zone. Fast
> travel allows someone to lead the entire dungeon to the
> zone exit, causing many people to die.
>
> Think about some of the worst zones for random deaths from trains,
> Mistmoore, Unrest, BlackBurrow. All these zones are "outdoors"
> and allow speed effects. The trainmaker can run fast and make it to zone,
> and lets everyone else deal with the trainwreck.
>
> In the dungeons that are "underground" there are usually less trains to
> zone (there are exceptions). This is because the person
> who gets over his head can't run fast enough to make it to zone.
> They will
> die 20 feet away and the train never happens.
>
> A caster gating out has the same effect as death. The monster drops the
> player off the hate list. Unless someone else is also on
> the hate list (or too close), the monster will return to it's normal spot.
